question_text: Which of the following ensures dual- or triple-channel memory operates correctly?
answer_options: Installing memory modules of identical capacity, speed, and type
Installing modules from different manufacturers to avoid conflicts
Placing all modules on the same side of the motherboard
Overclocking the memory modules beyond their rated speed
correct_answer: Installing memory modules of identical capacity, speed, and type
explanation: Matched memory modules are required for multi-channel configurations to operate optimally. Differences in specs may prevent the configuration from activating.
